thread.title: Premier League fantasy football tips: Who to pick and who to avoid in gameweek 21
thread.title_full: Premier League fantasy football tips: Who to pick and who to avoid in gameweek 21

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Premier League fantasy football tips: Who to pick and who to avoid in gameweek 21

locations.name: west ham vs crystal palace leicester

text:
West Ham vs Crystal Palace Leicester vs Chelsea (Saturday 5:30pm) Everton vs Manchester City (Sunday 1:30pm) Manchester United vs Liverpool (Sunday 4pm) Read More Key injuries/suspensions Bellerin is set to miss out for Arsenal (Photo: Shaun Botterill) 
After last weekend's FA Cup action, there aren't too many injuries and suspensions to worry about. 
Liverpool skipper Jordan Henderson is a doubt for his side's clash with Manchester United while Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been ill - but should play. 
Hector Bellerin, Francis Coquelin and Theo Walcott remains sidelined for Arsenal but Mesut Ozil is back to face Swansea. 
The likes of Sadio Mane, Wilfried Zaha and Riyad Mahrez are all away at AFCON. 
Dimitri Payet won't be playing for West Ham after going on strike. Favourable match-ups of the week Giroud has been in excellent form (Photo: David Price/Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 
They may be a bit of a bogey team for Arsenal but Swansea shouldn't be able to live with the Gunners this weekend. 
Arsene Wenger's side are scoring for fun at the moment and in Olivier Giroud they have a man bang in form. 
Expect the striker to continue his goalscoring run at the Liberty Stadium. 
Leicester have been lifting their game against the big boys but they face a Chelsea side who will be desperate to bounce back from their defeat at Spurs. 
This was the scene of Jose Mourinho's last game as Chelsea boss last term but fortunes have certainly changed for both sides. Big names and bandwagons to avoid Philippe Coutinho in action (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Philippe Coutinho returned from injury against Southampton but he may not be ready to start at Old Trafford - like he is expected to. 
Tottenham saw off Chelsea in style last time out but Harry Kane could struggle against a resolute West Brom defence. 
Join our free fantasy football game now. To download for IOS click here or for Android click here. Bargain corner Andre Gray appears back to his best (Photo: REUTERS) 
He has been in demand this month but Sunderland look set to keep hold of Jermain Defoe. 
And with Stoke in town, expect the former England striker to remind Black Cats fans how vital he is. 
Burnley have been excellent at home this term and face a Southampton side likely to be feeling the effects of their win over Liverpool. 
Andre Gray is back in form and will fancy his chances against Claude Puel's men. Who to captain Sunderland's Jermain Defoe celebrates (Photo: REUTERS) 
We're going big on Jermain Defoe this week. 
Stoke's form has been very inconsistent and these are the sort of games Sunderland need to win to stay up. 
Defoe should have a decent afternoon against the Potters. Read More
